action.action-desc: Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York (for himself, Mr. Connolly, and Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure, Homeland Security, and Veterans' Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 to extend the availability of paid leave for Federal employees for purposes relating to COVID-19, and for other purposes.

section.header: Extension of availability of emergency paid leave relating to COVID-19 for Federal employees

paragraph.text: Section 4001 of the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 (Public Law 117–2) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking September 30, 2022 and inserting December 31, 2023; and
in subsection (c)(1), by striking September 30, 2021 and inserting December 31, 2022.

paragraph.text: Section 7103 of such Act is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking September 30, 2022 and inserting December 31, 2023; and
in subsection (c)(1), by striking September 30, 2021 and inserting December 31, 2022.

paragraph.text: Section 7104 of such Act is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking September 30, 2022 and inserting December 31, 2023; and
in subsection (c)(1), by striking September 30, 2021 and inserting December 31, 2022.

paragraph.text: Section 8008 of such Act is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking September 20, 2022 and inserting December 31, 2023; and
in subsection (c)(1), by striking September 30, 2021 and inserting December 31, 2022.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to any leave taken under such section 4001, 7103, 7104, or 8008 (as the case may be) by an employee during the period beginning on October 1, 2021, and ending on December 31, 2022, subject to the terms and conditions of such applicable section.
